item.title: Random walk
item.description:
This is the first post of a series on some random(pun intended) topics related to random partial differential equations. Starting with random walk process (i have to start somewhere).

Disclaimer, I am doing this to understand and visualize the random experiments not doing any math. I am literally too old for this.

Starting with wiki blurb:

In mathematics, a random walk, sometimes known as a drunkard’s walk, is a stochastic process that describes a path that consists of a succession of random steps on some mathematical space.
